featured.text: Stradivarius, the undeniable king of violin makers, could not resist creating a variety of guitars.
Over the years, the fearless tribesmen have stood strong against slavery, and resisted the urging of the Kenyan and Tanzanian governments to adopt a more modern lifestyle.
They resist foreign influence because they were enslaved in the past.
Furthermore, elephants are known to resist leaving their sick or dying behind, and a herd may linger at a trench with a trapped baby for hours, reluctant to move on until all hope is lost.
Circular shapes are also stronger and resist deformation, and therefore can 20 extreme differences in pressure inside and outside of an aircraft.

definition.en_def: To withstand the action or effect of something.
definition.example: She tried to resist the temptation to eat dessert.
